file_content.text: Thanks for the help. Is it true kissing a Jedi brings good luck...?
The hero of the hour. Too bad the Republic frowns on fraternization.
Thanks for the help, Captain. I hear you're more than a bit hijacker yourself....
Thanks for your help.
I heard you sent the Black Suns packing. Have you tracked down where they took the cargo yet?
I'll send a security cleaning crew down there immediately.
Then we can try to patch up this operation.
I heard you sent the Black Suns packing. Have you tracked down where they took the cargo yet?
I suggest you go soon. Finaq's only got a few ships left on tonight's roster.
[Take the freight hauler to the Black Sun district.]
[Remain at the Galactic Market docks.]
What do you know...? A Jedi. Hardly the usual clientele.
The famous lieutenant, hero of the Republic... you're starting to get quite a reputation.
Hey there, stranger. You look like you know your way around a dock.
Agent Yorksin, SIS. Never mind the outfit. I'm undercover.
I need help. We've been moving our people into the Finaq Shipping Company for months. We want to stop contraband weapons shipments.
Now Black Sun's started hijacking Finaq's freighters--killing the crew and grabbing the cargo. If I send in SIS, our cover is blown; we start all over.
These gangs should not threaten an official Republic operation.
How can I help?
It wouldn't be the first time. Begging your pardon, Master Jedi.
It's an embarrassment when petty gangsters can bring down a Republic intelligence operation.
Tell me how to help.
Hardly our only embarrassment on Coruscant.
What are you asking, and what are you offering?
I might help... for a price.
Just say the word. I've got a weakness for women in uniform.
[Flirt] Anything for you.
And I've always been curious what Jedi wear... under those robes.
"Weakness"? Weak isn't exactly how I'd describe you....
I'm sorry.
So?
I can offer you a hefty payment if you help us flush out the hijackers and find the freight.
I think we can make a few hijackers regret their choice of career....
Sounds like a plan.
Once they're taken care of, we need to know where they take the freight.
You need me to bring back the cargo?
What then?
Just let me know where they're taking the freight. I'll send my team.
Try checking around the docks; Black Sun's got to have a loader programmed to offload the cargo somewhere secure.
Sorry. I can't put myself on the line like that.
Too risky. [Refuse quest]
Then whatever the Imperials have planned for these shipping freighters, they'll get it. I don't have the manpower to stop them.
Nothing to see here, friend.
When you reach the location, call me. I'll get local security to send in a cleanup team.
It's dangerous. But you could pose as a hauler, make yourself look vulnerable. Draw the hijackers in.
I'm at the warehouse where the Black Sun are hiding the freight.
Perfect. I've got the coordinates. Just leave the door open on your way out.
I'll send a crew to snag the cargo. Only wish I were there to express my... gratitude in person.
A man like you could pose as a hauler--strong, but flashy enough to draw the hijackers to you. Then... snap.
